means: （通常指金属）（使）失去光泽，（使）变灰暗

sentence.Network_en: The tarnish lay thick on the inside of the ring.
sentence.Network_cn: 戒指内侧有一层厚厚的锈斑。

sentence.Network_en: Moisture leads to the tarnish of the silverware.
sentence.Network_cn: 湿气使得银器毫无光泽.

sentence.Network_en: Wear cotton gloves when cleaning silver, because the acid in your skin can tarnish the metal.
sentence.Network_cn: 清洁银器时要戴上棉手套，因为你皮肤里的酸性物质会使它失去光泽。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb): from French terniss-, lengthened stem of ternir, from terne 'dark, dull'

entry.tran: 玷污，败坏，损害(名誉或形象)
entry.def: If you say that something tarnishes someone's reputation or image, you mean that it causes people to have a worse opinion of them than they would otherwise have had.

example.ex: The affair could tarnish the reputation of the prime minister...
example.tran: 这一事件可能有损首相的名誉。

example.ex: His image was tarnished by the savings and loan scandal.
example.tran: 他的形象因为那桩储蓄信贷丑闻而受损。

entry.tran: (使)有污迹;(使)失去光泽;(使)变暗淡
entry.def: If a metal tarnishes or if something tarnishes it, it becomes stained and loses its brightness.

example.tran: 它从不生锈，也不会失去光泽。

example.ex: Wear cotton gloves when cleaning silver, because the acid in your skin can tarnish the metal.
example.tran: 清洁银器时要戴上棉手套，因为你皮肤里的酸性物质会使它失去光泽。

entry.def: Tarnish is a substance which forms of the surface of some metals and which stains them or causes them to lose their brightness.

example.ex: The tarnish lay thick on the inside of the ring.
example.tran: 戒指内侧有一层厚厚的锈斑。

means.word_mean: 1. discoloration of metal surface caused by oxidation
1. make dirty or spotty, as by exposure to air; also used metaphorically;

sentences.sentence: "The silver was tarnished by the long exposure to the air"
"Her reputation was sullied after the affair with a married man"

auth_sentence.content: Many metals rapidly...tarnish when exposed to even the driest air.
auth_sentence.res_content: Many metals rapidly...tarnish when exposed to even the driest air.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Many metals rapidly...tarnish when exposed to even the driest air.

auth_sentence.content: The controversy threatens to tarnish the Government's free schools policy.
auth_sentence.res_content: The controversy threatens to tarnish the Government's free schools policy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The controversy threatens to tarnish the Government's free schools policy.

auth_sentence.content: His actions tarnish the industry's reputation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His actions tarnish the industry's reputation.

means.word_mean: (通常指金属)(使)失去光泽；(使)变灰暗

sentences.en: Brass tarnishes quickly in wet weather.
sentences.cn: 天气潮湿时黄铜很快会失去光泽。

sentences.en: His bad behaviour has tarnished the good name of the school.
sentences.cn: 他行为不轨, 败坏了学校的声誉。

means.word_mean: 污点, 瑕疵, 无光泽

sentences.en: Moisture leads to the tarnish of the silverware.
sentences.cn: 湿气使得银器毫无光泽。
